perturbation.original_text: (b) Diplomat or Tadeo, if such party is not in default of the terms of this Agreement, may extend the term of this Agreement for an additional one year ("Additional Period"), provided the extending party gives the other party at least sixty (60) days advance written notice before the end of the Period. If either party elects to extend the Agreement for the Additional Period, all other terms and conditions of this Agreement shall continue during the Additional Period.
perturbation.changed_text: (b) Diplomat or Tadeo, if such party is not in default of the terms of this Agreement, may extend the term of this Agreement for an additional one year ("Additional Period"), provided the extending party gives the other party at least sixty (60) days advance written notice before the end of the Period. The extension of the term of this agreement shall require a renegotiation of the service level agreement. If either party elects to extend the Agreement for the Additional Period, all other terms and conditions of this Agreement shall continue during the Additional Period.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that if either party extends the agreement, all other terms and conditions continue. The changed text adds that extension requires renegotiation of the service level agreement. This is contradictory because it is unclear whether the original service level will be used or a new agreement will be in effect. This introduces uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text:
Diplomat will pay to Tadeo when due a fee for each of the Services equal to the amount described in EXHIBIT A hereto relating to each such Service; PROVIDED, that in the event Diplomat terminates this Agreement in accordance with Section 3 hereof, the fee for the provision of each

- 2 -

terminated Service shall cease to accrue on and after the effective date of such termination. In the event that Diplomat terminates this Agreement other than in accordance with Section 3, Diplomat shall be obligated to pay for the Services in accordance with the fee schedule contained on EXHIBIT A throughout the balance of the Period (as hereinafter defined) as though Tadeo continued to provide the terminated Services through the balance of the Period. Late payments shall accrue interest at a rate equal to fifteen (15%) percent per annum.
perturbation.changed_text:
Diplomat will pay to Tadeo when due a fee for each of the Services equal to the amount described in EXHIBIT A hereto relating to each such Service; PROVIDED, that in the event Diplomat terminates this Agreement in accordance with Section 3 hereof, the fee for the provision of each

- 2 -

terminated Service shall cease to accrue on and after the effective date of such termination. In the event that Diplomat terminates this Agreement other than in accordance with Section 3, Diplomat may still be obligated to pay for the Services in accordance with the fee schedule contained on EXHIBIT A throughout the balance of the Period (as hereinafter defined) as though Tadeo continued to provide the terminated Services through the balance of the Period. Late payments shall accrue interest at a rate equal to fifteen (15%) percent per annum.
perturbation.explanation: In the original, if Diplomat terminates the agreement not in accordance with Section 3, they "shall be obligated to pay." The modified version states that Diplomat "may still be obligated to pay." This is contradictory because the original text indicates a certainty of payment, whereas the changed text introduces uncertainty. This could cause disagreement over payment obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
Section 6.     INDEPENDENT CONTRACTORS.

Tadeo and Diplomat are independent contractors. There is no relationship of partnership, joint venture, employment, franchise or agency between Tadeo and Diplomat. Neither Tadeo nor Diplomat shall have the power to bind the other or incur obligations on the other's behalf without the other's prior written consent. When Tadeo's employees act under the terms of this Agreement, they shall be deemed at all times to be under the supervision and responsibility of Tadeo and no person employed by Tadeo and acting under the terms of this Agreement shall be deemed to be acting as agent or employee of Diplomat or any customer of Diplomat for any purpose whatsoever.
perturbation.changed_text:
Section 6.     INDEPENDENT CONTRACTORS.

Tadeo and Diplomat are independent contractors. There is no relationship of partnership, joint venture, employment, franchise or agency between Tadeo and Diplomat. Neither Tadeo nor Diplomat shall have the power to bind the other or incur obligations on the other's behalf without the other's prior written consent. When Tadeo's employees act under the terms of this Agreement, they shall be deemed at all times to be under the supervision and responsibility of Tadeo and no person employed by Tadeo and acting under the terms of this Agreement shall be deemed to be acting as agent or employee of Diplomat or any customer of Diplomat for routine matters.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that Tadeo's employees are never agents or employees of Diplomat. The modified version adds the phrase "for routine matters." This creates a contradiction. It is unclear whether the Tadeo employees are or aren't Diplomat's agents/employees in non-routine matters, creating ambiguity. It creates uncertainty because it's ambiguous when and if agency can exist.
